Events that occurred on 14 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1954 - C.S. Lewis reviews The Fellowship of the Ring for Time and Tide.
1972 - Richard Jeffery sends a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien (see Letter 347).
1976 - Mythcon 7 in Sacramento, California.
1982 - The fifth episode of the new version of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1982 - Dorothy Whitelock, former colleague of J.R.R. Tolkien, dies.
1982 - Mythcon 13 at Chapman College in Orange, California.
1983 - Mythcon 14 at Scripps College in Claremont, California.
2005 - The Tolkien Society's Tolkien 2005 conference in Birmingham, England.
2010 - "Edge of the Wild", Tolkien art exhibition in Moreton-in-Marsh, England.
2011 - Omentielva Cantea - 4th International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Valencia, Spain.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
After the funeral of Théoden, Éomer's guests take leave. Arwen bids farewell to her father and brothers. Éomer and Éowyn give Merry a great horn.[1]

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
